main.name: Theo Olsen
main.occupation: Software Development, Data Analytics, and Business Enthusiast
main.bio: I have experience working with web frameworks, leveraging data, diving deep into software code, and starting businesses. As my time in college ends I've found that I am more interested in doing meaningful work rather than fitting into a certain career path. When I have spare time you can catch me making games and dancing.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: By building a wide base of experience in different languages, I have also become capable at picking up new ones.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Business
education.description: Minors in Chinese and Data Science

work.company: Sony Research and Development, San Jose CA
work.title: Marketing Consultant and Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Leveraged React and Materials-UI to develop Web App to empower disconnected youth. Collaborated with marketing team of 4+ to research market trends, communicate with clients, and improve UX. Pitched the product to potential investors as a part of the Lehigh Silicon Valley Innovation Internship program

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Contributed to an international project with Australia related to the AEGIS Defense System. Leveraged C++ and Java to make contributions to components within a larger codebase. Utilized Python scripting to generate header files for my team and streamline installation for the customer. Worked in an Agile and Scrum environment of 10 people, and presented at program wide demos. Acquired Secret Security Clearance.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Added additional layout functionality to road design software for engineers using C++. Collaborated with a team of 4 colleagues with different language backgrounds. Observed and studied the workings of a professional environment in China.

work.company: Lehigh University Office of Residence Life
work.title: Gryphon (Residential Assistant)
work.description: Mentored and supervised 22 first-year students, supporting their safety and success. Organized over 10 residence hall events and upheld school policy.

projects.title: Game Development
projects.category: I make games in my spare time

projects2.title: Online Data Storage Service
projects2.blurb: Created in Operating Systems Class. Clients connect to a server that utilizes encryption, multiple threads, and usage quotas to persistently manage clientâ€™s data and functions. C++.

projects2.title: Capstone Project
projects2.blurb: Created a web application to manage user subscriptions to Lutron features and open up new revenue streams. Worked in a team of 4 using Agile and Scrum methodologies. Advised by Lutron Electronics. AWS Amplify. DynamoDB. HTML. CSS. Python. React.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
